Investigating rodent activity within houses in Eastern Sierra Leone.

Rodent
Ecology
Camera Trapping
In Preparation
Author
David Simons

The Royal Veterinary College

Published

October 1, 2022

Abstract
The location of human infection with Lassa Fever is not known. Humans may encounter rodents in various habitats in endemic regions. We were interested in how rodents use space within human houses and so alongside our rodent trapping studies we deployed camera traps to observe their behaviour.

This work has been led by Najmul Haider and is in preparation. We are collecting camera images from locations where we are trapping rodents to better characterise the risk to individuals in these locations.
